00001 <h2>Browse PHP online documentation. Quickly</h2>
00002 <p class="centered">
00003         <img id="screenshot" style="margin: 10px"
00004                 src="/assets/images/software/widgets/phpquickreference/phpquickreference-screenshot-0.8.png"
00005                 alt="PHPQuickReference Widget" /></p>
00006 <p>
00007         PHPQuickReference is a widget to search, browse and display online PHP documentation.
00008         All you have to do is enter the term you want to know about and it will do the rest.
00009         The widget provides basic HTML formatting and intelligent hyperlink management.
00010         Links recognized as reference topics are automatically browsed by the widget itself.
00011         Other links are sent to the default browser.
00012 </p>
00013 
00014 <p>
00015         But there's more: the widget now features <strong>autocompletion</strong> and <strong>hints</strong>.
00016         The widget suggests you the longest viable prefix for a given input string, and it's even able to
00017         suggest all function names that begin by that prefix.
00018         It's way easier to understand how it works trying by yourself than to explain.
00019         Once you'll try it you won't be able to do without it anymore! 
00020 </p>
00021 
00022 <p>
00023         If you are a PHP developer, PHPQuickReference is what you were searching for.
00024         If you are a PHP newbie and you're greedy to learn, it gives you an easy way to
00025         search through the huge PHP reference.
00026         Just fire up Dashboard and find the reference of that function you don't remember!
00027 </p>
00028 <p>
00029         Minimum system requirements are Mac OS X 10.4 "Tiger" or later, and an Internet connection (broadband recommended).
00030 </p>
00031 <p>
00032         Suggestions for improvements are more than welcome. PHPQuickReference Widget is freeware and costs you nothing.
00033         If you wish to support development and distribution, you can
00034         <?php $this->link_to('make a donation', array('controller' => 'donate')); ?>.
00035 </p>
